results.title: Metformin attenuates sevoflurane-induced neurogenesis damage and cognitive impairment: involvement of the Nrf2/G6PD pathway.
results.text_hl: However, treatment with the @GENE_NFE2L2 @GENE_83619 @@@Nrf2@@@ inhibitor, ML385 or the @GENE_G6PD @GENE_24377 @@@G6PD@@@ inhibitor, @CHEMICAL_Dehydroepiandrosterone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003687 @@@dehydroepiandrosterone@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Dehydroepiandrosterone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003687 @@@DHEA@@@) reversed the protective effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @CHEMICAL_Sevoflurane @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077149 @@@sevoflurane@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_617394</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:617394 @@@NSC damage@@@ in vitro.

citations.NLM: Fan P, Lu Y, Wei H, Wang K, Jia P, Zhang Y, Zhang Y, Wang T, Yang L, Zhao J, Zhang S, Lu H, Chen X, Liu Y, Zhang P. Metformin attenuates sevoflurane-induced neurogenesis damage and cognitive impairment: involvement of the Nrf2/G6PD pathway. Metab Brain Dis. 2023 Apr 29;():. PMID: 37119382
